Description: Torso of figure of Eros. Part of a plaster group: Eros fishing, seated on a rock.His left arm is lowered with his hand on the rock. The wings are well preserved, and to the left one is attached the minute remains of another figure, separately made, perhaps Aphrodite. The back is summarily modelled, with only the rock shown in any detail. The underside is rough and may be detached from a wide plinth or other object that also supported the missing figure on the left side of Eros. Presumably made in a multiple piecemould. White plaster, with the feathers of the wings picked out in red, black and white paint; black and red paint also decorate the rock, which has a wide black band at the bottom. A black line separates Eros’ wing from the remaining part of the companion figure.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. Near: Graindor 1939: pl. vi:10, in terracotta; compare also a bronze figure from Athribis: Perdrizet 1911: no. 7, pl. xxxiv. Bibliog. Grenfell and Hunt 1905: 16.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3362)
Condition: Head and extended right arm (probably holding rod, not of plaster) are lost.
